article.headline: BYU 79, Colorado State 73
article.story: FORT COLLINS, Colo. (AP) -- Rafael Araujo had 21 points and 12 rebounds and Mike Hall added 14 points as BYU defeated Colorado State 79-73 on Monday night. Mark Bigelow added 10 points as BYU (16-7, 6-4 Mountain West Conference) won its fourth straight. Araujo was 7-for-17 shooting but hit 7-of-10 free throws. It was his 13th double-double of the season. Matt Nelson had 24 points and seven rebounds for Colorado State (11-12, 3-7) in his first game back after missing four games with a sprained right knee. Dwight Boatner had 11 points. Nelson tied the game at 54 with 8:31 remaining, but BYU then held the Rams to only a basket and free throw for nearly three minutes. With Araujo on the bench with four fouls, Jake Shoff followed a missed free throw with a tip-in and then completed a three-point play as BYU took a 66-57 lead with 5:24 left. Colorado State got no closer than 73-68 after Nelson's layup with 1:18 to go. BYU led 35-32 at halftime after struggling in the early going. The Cougars hit just four of their first 16 and fell behind 19-8 with 11:36 left in the half. Hall came off the bench to hit a breakaway dunk and a 3-pointer as BYU outscored Colorado State 25-7 over seven minutes. Colorado State scored the last six points of the half and Freddy Robinson's jumper with 31 seconds left closed the gap to three points.
